articles.title: March BULLETIN 1975
articles.summary: The March 1975 Bulletin details club leadership and recent activities, including a general meeting featuring presentations on deep-sky and Messier objects, and a pitch for the Astronomical Society of the Pacific. It also reports on a lightly attended but successful star party where attendees enjoyed clear views of Saturn. The bulletin also humorously notes a donation by the treasurer to improve the newsletter's printing quality, granting him a 'deed' to a crater on Ganymede.

articles.title: COMING EVENTS:
articles.summary: This document outlines upcoming astronomical events including a general meeting on March 7, 1975, featuring a lecture on a 15" telescope and a 'bring-your-own-slides' night, a board meeting on March 14, and a star party at Henry Coe State Park on March 15. It also announces a change of venue for the Riverside Telescope Makers convention to Bear Valley and provides a technical note explaining how to calculate composite magnitudes for multiple star systems.
